org.gradoop.flink.model.impl.operators.drilling.functions.transformations

Class RollUpTransformation<EL extends Element>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gradoop.flink.model.impl.operators.drilling.functions.transformations.DrillTransformation<EL>
      • org.gradoop.flink.model.impl.operators.drilling.functions.transformations.RollUpTransformation<EL>
  • Type Parameters:
    EL - element
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, TransformationFunction<EL>

    public class RollUpTransformation<EL extends Element>
extends DrillTransformation<EL>
    Logical graph transformation which rolls up a property value of a given key. This class is used for vertices and edges.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • RollUpTransformation

        public RollUpTransformation(String label,
                            String propertyKey,
                            DrillFunction function,
                            String newPropertyKey,
                            boolean drillAllLabels,
                            boolean keepCurrentPropertyKey)
        Valued constructor.
        Parameters:
        label - label of the element whose property shall be rolled
        propertyKey - property key
        function - drill function which shall be applied to a property
        newPropertyKey - new property key
        drillAllLabels - true, if all elements of an element shall be drilled
        keepCurrentPropertyKey - true, if the current property key shall be reused

    • Method Detail

      • apply

        public EL apply(EL current,
                EL transformed)
        Description copied from interface: TransformationFunction
        The method takes the current version of the element and a copy of that element as input. The copy is initialized with the current structural information (i.e. identifiers, graph membership, source / target identifiers). The implementation is able to transform the element by either updating the current version and return it or by adding necessary information to the new entity and return it.
        Parameters:
        current - current element
        transformed - structural identical, but plain element
        Returns:
        transformed element
